trans-unit.source: You can use the <ui>Quantize</ui> module to bin numbers.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <ui>Quantize</ui> module to bin numbers.

trans-unit.source: This module is provided for backward compatibility with experiments created using the pre-release version of Azure Machine Learning, and will soon be deprecated.
trans-unit.target: This module is provided for backward compatibility with experiments created using the pre-release version of Azure Machine Learning, and will soon be deprecated.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you modify your experiments to use <link xlink:href="61dd433a-ee80-4ac3-87f0-b54708644d93" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Quantize Data</link> instead.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you modify your experiments to use <link xlink:href="61dd433a-ee80-4ac3-87f0-b54708644d93" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Quantize Data</link> instead.

trans-unit.source: This module is useful for binning and flattening the distribution of continuous data
trans-unit.target: This module is useful for binning and flattening the distribution of continuous data

trans-unit.source: During binning, each input element is mapped to a bin by comparing its value against positions of bin edges.
trans-unit.target: During binning, each input element is mapped to a bin by comparing its value against positions of bin edges.

trans-unit.source: For example, if value is 1.5 and bin edges are 1,2,3, the element would be mapped to bin number 2.
trans-unit.target: For example, if value is 1.5 and bin edges are 1,2,3, the element would be mapped to bin number 2.

trans-unit.source: Value 0.5 would be mapped to bin number 1 (the underflow bin), and value 3.5 would be mapped to bin number 4 (the overflow bin).
trans-unit.target: Value 0.5 would be mapped to bin number 1 (the underflow bin), and value 3.5 would be mapped to bin number 4 (the overflow bin).

trans-unit.source: The help for this module was based on an early release version and will not be updated because this module is deprecated.
trans-unit.target: The help for this module was based on an early release version and will not be updated because this module is deprecated.

trans-unit.source: For up-to-date information about how quantization works, see the help topic for <link xlink:href="61dd433a-ee80-4ac3-87f0-b54708644d93" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Quantize Data</link>.
trans-unit.target: For up-to-date information about how quantization works, see the help topic for <link xlink:href="61dd433a-ee80-4ac3-87f0-b54708644d93" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Quantize Data</link>.

trans-unit.source: The option <ui>Tag columns as categorical</ui> can be used to control whether the quantized columns become categorical variables.
trans-unit.target: The option <ui>Tag columns as categorical</ui> can be used to control whether the quantized columns become categorical variables.

trans-unit.source: To apply different quantization rules to different columns, chain together multiple instances of the <ui>Quantize</ui> module, and in each instance select a subset of columns to quantize.
trans-unit.target: To apply different quantization rules to different columns, chain together multiple instances of the <ui>Quantize</ui> module, and in each instance select a subset of columns to quantize.

trans-unit.source: The same binning rule is applied to all columns specified in list of columns to quantize.
trans-unit.target: The same binning rule is applied to all columns specified in list of columns to quantize.

trans-unit.source: The output mode specifies how the quantized values are returned.
trans-unit.target: The output mode specifies how the quantized values are returned.

trans-unit.source: Choices include appending input table, overwriting columns in input table, and returning result columns only.
trans-unit.target: Choices include appending input table, overwriting columns in input table, and returning result columns only.

trans-unit.source: Input columns must be numeric, and for quantile binning there must be a sufficient range of data points to determine the quantiles.
trans-unit.target: Input columns must be numeric, and for quantile binning there must be a sufficient range of data points to determine the quantiles.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise an error or NaN result may occur.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise an error or NaN result may occur.

trans-unit.source: This is the natural convention for quantiles (1st quantile, 2nd quantile, and so on).
trans-unit.target: This is the natural convention for quantiles (1st quantile, 2nd quantile, and so on).

trans-unit.source: The only exception is the case when the column to bin is sparse.
trans-unit.target: The only exception is the case when the column to bin is sparse.

trans-unit.source: All NaNs and missing values are propagated from input to output column.
trans-unit.target: All NaNs and missing values are propagated from input to output column.

trans-unit.source: The only exception is the case when the module returns quantile indexes.
trans-unit.target: The only exception is the case when the module returns quantile indexes.

trans-unit.source: In this case all NaNs are promoted to missing values.
trans-unit.target: In this case all NaNs are promoted to missing values.

trans-unit.source: If the column to bin (quantize) is sparse, then the bin index offset (quantile offset) is used when resulting column is populated.
trans-unit.target: If the column to bin (quantize) is sparse, then the bin index offset (quantile offset) is used when resulting column is populated.

trans-unit.source: The offset is chosen so that sparse 0 always goes to the bin with index 0 (quantile with value 0).
trans-unit.target: The offset is chosen so that sparse 0 always goes to the bin with index 0 (quantile with value 0).

trans-unit.source: As a result, sparse zeros are propagated from input to output column.
trans-unit.target: As a result, sparse zeros are propagated from input to output column.

trans-unit.source: Notice that processing of dense column always produces a result with a minimum bin index equal to 1 (in other words, the minimum quantile value equals the minimum value in the column).
trans-unit.target: Notice that processing of dense column always produces a result with a minimum bin index equal to 1 (in other words, the minimum quantile value equals the minimum value in the column).

trans-unit.source: Processing of a sparse column produces a result with variable values for the minimum bin index (minimum quantile value).
trans-unit.target: Processing of a sparse column produces a result with variable values for the minimum bin index (minimum quantile value).

trans-unit.source: Indicate how quantized columns should be output
trans-unit.target: Indicate how quantized columns should be output

trans-unit.source: Indicate whether output columns should be tagged as categorical
trans-unit.target: Indicate whether output columns should be tagged as categorical

trans-unit.source: Function that applies quantization to the dataset
trans-unit.target: Function that applies quantization to the dataset

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if one or more of inputs are null or empty.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if one or more of inputs are null or empty.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if parameter is less than or equal to specific value.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if parameter is less than or equal to specific value.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if passed column set argument does not apply to any of dataset columns.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if passed column set argument does not apply to any of dataset columns.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if number of rows in some of the datasets passed to the module is too small.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if number of rows in some of the datasets passed to the module is too small.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if dataset does not contain a label column.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if dataset does not contain a label column.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if number of columns in some of the datasets passed to the module is too small.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if number of columns in some of the datasets passed to the module is too small.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if number of elements expected should be an exact value, but is not.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if number of elements expected should be an exact value, but is not.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if parameter is less than a specific value.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if parameter is less than a specific value.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if one or more parameters could not be parsed or converted from specified type into required by target method type.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if one or more parameters could not be parsed or converted from specified type into required by target method type.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if column is expected to contain sorted values, but it does not.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if column is expected to contain sorted values, but it does not.

trans-unit.source: Exception occurs if operation has failed.
trans-unit.target: Exception occurs if operation has failed.
